entries.definition: An abstract representational system used in the study of numbers, shapes, structure, change and the relationships between these concepts.
examples: My mathematics is always improving.

entries.definition: Inflammation of a joint or joints causing pain and/or disability, swelling and stiffness, and due to various causes such as infection, trauma, degenerative changes or metabolic disorders.
The disease or disorder of abnormally high blood pressure.
Ice hockey, a game on ice in which two teams of six players skate and try to score by shooting a puck into the opposing team's net, using their sticks.
The science or study of rockets and their design.
examples: It's not rocket science. Just screw in the bulb and flip the switch.

entries.definition: The food and beverage a person or animal consumes.
examples: The diet of the Giant Panda consists mainly of bamboo.
He's been reading a steady diet of nonfiction for the last several years.
diet soda

entries.definition: A disease, occurring especially in women following menopause, in which the bones become extremely porous and are subject to fracture.
To cause to move in a curve.
examples: I curl at my local club every weekend.
a scornful curling of the lip

entries.definition: To hit a fly ball; to hit a fly ball that is caught for an out. Compare ground (verb) and line (verb).
examples: Jones flied to right in his last at-bat.
Birds of passage fly to warmer regions as it gets colder in winter.
Fly, my lord! The enemy are upon us!

entries.definition: To lower the temperature of something; to cool
examples: Chill before serving.
In the wind he chilled quickly.
Chill, man, we've got a whole week to do it; no sense in getting worked up.

entries.definition: The act or process by which something is built; construction.
examples: The building of the bridge will be completed in a couple of weeks.
My sister lives in that apartment building.

entries.definition: Strong affection.
examples: Hello love, how can I help you?
I love my spouse.   I love you!
Mold loves moist, dark places.

entries.definition: To propel oneself rapidly upward, downward and/or in any horizontal direction such that momentum causes the body to become airborne.
examples: Kangaroos are known for their ability to jump high.
She is going to jump from the diving board.
to jump a stream

entries.definition: To cry out with a shrill voice; to utter a sudden, sharp outcry, or shrill, loud cry, as in fright or extreme pain; to shriek; to screech.
examples: He almost hit a pole, the way he came screaming down the hill.
Do you know what screams "I'm obnoxious"? People who feel the need to comment on every little thing they notice.
Did you see that guy at the bar? Screaming!

entries.definition: To creep; to move slowly on hands and knees, or by dragging the body along the ground.
examples: Clutching my wounded side, I crawled back to the trench.
The rush-hour traffic crawled around the bypass.
Don't come crawling to me with your useless apologies!

entries.definition: To rotate, revolve, gyrate (usually quickly); to partially or completely rotate to face another direction.
examples: I spun myself around a few times.
They spin the cotton into thread.
to spin along the road in a carriage, on a bicycle, etc.

entries.definition: A craft used for transportation of goods, fishing, racing, recreational cruising, or military use on or in the water, propelled by oars or outboard motor or inboard motor or by wind.
examples: a stone boat;  a gravy boat
to boat goods
to boat oars

entries.definition: (heading) To use one's voice.
examples: He felt called to help the old man.
A recursive function is one that calls itself.

entries.definition: To turn by means of a crank.
examples: Motorists had to crank their engine by hand.
He's been cranking all day and yet it refuses to crank.
He's been cranking all day and yet it refuses to crank.

entries.definition: (of a sound or sound waves) To reflect off a surface and return.
examples: Sid echoed his father's point of view.

entries.definition: To work on a farm, especially in the growing and harvesting of crops.
examples: to farm the taxes
Farm out the stable and pigsty.

entries.definition: To ride a snowboard.
An action, state of mind, or object one has an obligation to perform for another, adopt toward another, or give to another.
examples: I am in your debt.

entries.definition: A crucial or decisive point or situation; a turning point.
To make the shrill sound characteristic of a rooster; to make a sound in this manner, either in gaiety, joy, pleasure, or defiance.
examples: He's been crowing all day about winning the game of cards.

entries.definition: To take control of; to seize by force or stratagem.
examples: to capture an enemy, a vessel, or a criminal
She captured the details of the fresco in a series of photographs.
His film adaptation captured the spirit of the original work.

entries.definition: To agitate rapidly and repetitively, or to stir with a rowing or rocking motion; generally applies to liquids, notably cream.
examples: Now the cream is churned to make butter.
I was so nervous that my stomach was churning.
